Text: I suspect you haven't heard much about the Competitiveness bill that's in the Senate right now. Here‚Äôs what you need to know: the taxpayers of this country should not be giving $53 billion to profitable microchip companies and $10 billion to Jeff Bezos to go to space. Period. https://t.co/2eriaC8oKw

TONIGHT: Right now, we are in a global struggle between autocracy and democracy, with nothing less than the future of the planet at stake. Please join me, @BLeeForCongress, @PeterBeinart, @brhodes, and @MariaRepnikova for a town hall discussion this evening at 8 PM ET. https://t.co/5RKhq1Kgtc

I stand in solidarity with¬†Maximus¬†workers walking out of federal call centers across the country today. To my mind, we should not allow greedy corporations to privatize public services or profit from robbing workers of fair pay and benefits. https://t.co/xCpCxCvCdL
We have never seen in this country the level of corporate greed that we are seeing right now.

The baseball oligarchs are far more concerned with increasing their wealth and profits than in strengthening our national pastime. We must prevent their greed from destroying the game. The best way to do that is to end Major League Baseball‚Äôs antitrust exemption. https://t.co/aLwS4WUuAf

The richest in the world want more money for yachts and rockets to zoom around outer space, and that's called rational.

The rest of the population wants a roof over their heads, a decent wage, and a life of dignity, and that's called 'radical.'

Does that make any sense at all?

Join me and special guests @BLeeForCongress, @PeterBeinart and @brhodes this Wednesday at 8 PM ET for a town hall discussion about the progressive response on foreign policy and the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/P6y599D7fM

We need leaders who will come to Congress ready to fight ‚Äî fight on behalf of the poor, fight on behalf of the working class, fight for Medicare for All, and fight for a Green New Deal. @SummerForPA will be that leader. https://t.co/Mxp6WV1rm1

Congratulations to the workers at Starbucks for your union organizing success. A union means not only better wages and working conditions, it means having some control over your job and not just being a cog in the machine.¬†It means being more human.

Corporate greed is Nike increasing its profit by 125% last year to $5.7 billion & blaming "inflation" for a 10.5% price spike on a pair of expensive sneakers made by workers in Vietnam earning less than a buck an hour while Phil Knight became $26.7 billion richer in the pandemic.

This is Russia's Oligarchy. In 2017, it was estimated Putin was worth some $200 billion.¬†Last year, Russia‚Äôs 120 billionaires owned $588 billion in wealth, equal to 60% of the country‚Äôs household wealth.¬†We must destroy global oligarchy and create an economy that works for all.

Since it was announced that Howard Schultz (worth $4 billion) would be coming back as Starbucks CEO he has become $145 million richer ‚Äì in just 2 days. It would take 4,600 years for the minimum wage worker at Starbucks to make that much money. Yes. Starbucks workers need a union.

I am proud to endorse @SummerForPA for Congress. Summer is an experienced organizer, legislator, and a champion for Medicare for All, a $15 minimum wage, expanding voting rights, and a Green New Deal. I know she will continue to fight for those ideas when she's in the Congress. https://t.co/FokYMPrrH3

Over the past 5 days, the average wholesale gas price has gone DOWN by 21 cents a gallon and the price of oil has gone DOWN by over $15 a barrel.
¬†
Meanwhile, the average price of a gallon of gas at the pump has gone UP by 21 cents a gallon.
¬†
Yes. We need a windfall profits tax.
We need to end our dependence on fossil fuels.

If you want to understand why the movement to organize unions at Starbucks is spreading like wildfire, look at how the company is treating workers demanding a voice on the job. Starbucks is not a poor company. It should stop retaliating and allow workers to organize. https://t.co/VCSLH1FXjV

Overall, women are paid just $0.73 for every $1 men are paid. Black women are paid $0.64. Latina and Native American women are paid $0.54. How insane is that?

It's 2022. Equal pay for equal work is not a radical idea ‚Äî it's an issue of basic justice. #EqualPayDay
If every other major country on the planet can provide universal health care to all its people, why can't we?

It is insane that while MIT's endowment grew by over $9 BILLION in 2021, nearly 1 in 4 grad students struggle to keep up with cost of living. I say to MIT: invest in your students. I stand in solidarity with @MITGradUnion in their efforts to form a union.

61% of Americans with medical debt have employer-provided health insurance.

#MedicareForAll

This is a broken health care system. While 23 million Americans owe $228 billion in medical debt, 178 CEOs of healthcare companies made $3.2 billion in compensation in 2020. UnitedHealth alone made a record $24 billion in profits last year. Yes. We need Medicare for All.
Shocking. Gas prices are at the highest levels ever at the same time the big oil companies are raking in huge profits. Yes, the time is now for a windfall profits tax. https://t.co/6ObFF3jKFB

Starbucks claims to be a ‚Äúprogressive‚Äù company that values its ‚Äúpartners,‚Äù yet it's firing workers for "the crime" of being pro-union & spending millions on a union busting law firm. I say to Starbucks: Stop the union busting. Stop the coercion. Treat your workers with respect.
The time is now to invest in public education. I am proud to stand with @MFT59 educators who are on strike for decent pay and better working conditions. https://t.co/M2rURKqDLY

This is what oligarchy looks like: Today, the 10 richest people in the world own more wealth than the bottom 37% ‚Äî 3.1 billion people. We need a national and global economy that works for all, not just the few. The struggle continues. https://t.co/77hO6flgkT

Starbucks workers have now voted to join unions 6 out of 7 times. Union elections will soon be held in over 120 more shops. The movement to unionize Starbucks is spreading like wildfire. Now, would be a very good time for Starbucks to end union busting & embrace this movement.
A multi-billionaire with a superyacht should not pay less in taxes than a firefighter.

I'm proud to endorse @JasmineForUS for Congress. Jasmine understands that we need progressives in Washington who will fight to make it easier to vote in this country, who will fight for the rights of workers, and who will fight for an economy that works for all of us. https://t.co/veaKIywiVj
No one should have to ration their insulin in this country.

In the midst of Putin's horrific invasion of Ukraine, I want to express my solidarity with the many thousands of Russians who are out on the streets protesting the war. In an authoritarian society, they are risking their freedom and lives. They are showing incredible courage.

Global oligarchy is on the rise. Between 1995 and 2021, the top 1% captured 38% of the increase in global wealth, while the bottom 50% captured 2%. The share of wealth owned by the global top 0.1% rose from 7% to 11%. Children go hungry. Billionaires buy yachts. Not acceptable.

We have elections in this country which are dominated by big money and corporate interests. And whether or not our democracy survives depends on if we stand up together and put a stop to growing oligarchy. https://t.co/pgkgDk98eD
I have so much respect for the incredibly brave people in Russia who are risking so much by being out in the streets protesting what their corrupt president is doing. https://t.co/RKYWQqflld

Worker productivity is up 62% since the 1970s, yet wages have barely budged in the same period ‚Äî meanwhile, CEOs in this country have seen their pay explode by 1,322%.

Does anyone REALLY think CEOs are working 1,322% harder than they did in 1978?

The 30 Major League Baseball owners are worth over $100 billion. The value of their teams increased by more than $41 billion since they bought them. Mr. Manfred: End the lockout. Negotiate in good faith. Don't let the greed of baseball owners take away our national past time.

Congratulations to @GregCasar on winning your primary in TX-35! Greg will be a progressive force for the people, ready to fight for the needs of the working class. I'm looking forward to working with him in Congress. https://t.co/yEba8938Pg

Now, more than ever, those of us who believe in democracy and justice must work to bring working people all over the world together. Instead of hate & divisiveness, let us take on the greed & ideology of the top 1% and fight for economic, social & environmental justice. (14/14)

None of these oligarchs should be allowed to park their yachts, fly their jets, sleep in their mansions, or stash their cash offshore during the war in Ukraine. But much more must be done to stop the movement to oligarchy not just in Russia, but all over the world. (13/14)

6 Russian oligarchs and their families who hold $66.3 billion in wealth own 13 properties in New York worth $588 million including a 75-foot wide townhouse and an $88 million penthouse. (12/14) https://t.co/z6d5vWhYZI
According to Bloomberg, ‚ÄúAt least four [Russian-owned] super yachts remained anchored in Barcelona. Two were last parked along the Florida coast, in Miami and Palm Beach.‚Äù (11/14)

Alexey Mordashov, the third richest person in Russia worth $23 billion, owns a Bombardier Global 6000 private jet and a $500 million yacht that has been sailing in the Seychelles region for more than 10 days. (10/14)

Dmitry Mazepin, a Russian oligarch worth over $1.3 billion & a former president of a major Russian gas company, owns a Gulfstream G650 private jet that recently flew over the New York area. Mazepin recently attended a meeting with Putin and a dozen other oligarchs. (9/14)

Alisher Usmanov, a Russian oligarch worth over $20 billion who owns Russia‚Äôs largest iron ore company, a telecommunications company and a newspaper in Russia, holds stakes in Airbnb, Spotify, Uber Technologies and was an early investor in Facebook. (8/14)

Roman Abramovich, a Russian oligarch worth $13 billion, owns the world's 2nd largest yacht worth $600 million with its own missile detection system. He owns the English football club Chelsea worth $2.1 billion, a $170 million mansion in the UK & another yacht in Barcelona. (7/14)

While people in Ukraine and Russia suffer, Putin owns a 270-foot long super yacht that he took out of Germany before the invasion of Ukraine. Putin‚Äôs yacht is equipped with a gym, a saloon, a spa, a library & a 49-foot indoor pool that can be converted into a dance floor. (6/14)

In 2017, it was estimated that Putin was worth $200 billion which, at the time, made him wealthier than Bill Gates & Jeff Bezos combined. No one knows how much Putin is worth today, but 22 other Russian oligarchs have a combined net worth of nearly $300 billion today. (5/14)

The hidden offshore wealth of Russia‚Äôs oligarchs amounted to about 85% of Russia‚Äôs GDP in 2015. While 18 million people in Russia were living in poverty last year, Russia‚Äôs 120 billionaires owned $588 billion in wealth equal to 60% of the total household wealth in Russia. (4/14)

The top 0.01% in Russia has stashed over two-thirds of its wealth offshore, while the top 1% in Russia owns as much wealth offshore as the rest of the Russian population holds onshore. Globally, the rich & powerful have stashed at least $21 trillion in offshore tax havens. (3/14)

Incredibly, the 500 richest people in Russia with a net worth of at least $100 million now own more wealth than the bottom 99.8% of Russia‚Äôs population - 145 million people. This is the type of inequality that exists not just in Russia, but throughout the world. (2/14)

Putin is not only an autocrat who initiated an illegal & immoral war against Ukraine, he's the leader of an oligarchic kleptocracy that's stolen billions from the Russian people. In Russia, ordinary people struggle while Oligarchs make out like bandits ‚Äì which they are. (1/14)

It is no great secret that we have a broken criminal justice system in this country. @MerrittForTexas has the courage to stand up and to take on the powerful. As Texas Attorney General, he will make it clear that no CEO is too big to jail. https://t.co/Nj7gB85WU7

TEXAS: today you've got the chance to vote for bold leaders who will fight for the needs of working people.

In TX-28: @JCisnerosTX for U.S. Congress
In TX-35: @GregCasar for U.S. Congress
For Attorney General: @MerrittForTexas

Polls are open NOW until 7 PM. 

VOTE! VOTE! VOTE! https://t.co/1DfsrUBEao

I stand in solidarity with the 1,300 workers at the Hershey's factory in Virginia who are voting to join a union after the company made a $1.47 billion profit last year. I say to Hershey's: Stop the union busting. Stop the intimidation. Treat your workers with dignity & respect.
At a time when so many Americans are hurting and feel totally powerless, Starbucks workers are taking on corporate greed and winning. They are an inspiration to all of us. https://t.co/wAlf8hF3ci

Congratulations to the workers in Mesa, Arizona for overwhelmingly voting to form the 3rd union shop at Starbucks. The movement to unionize Starbucks is spreading like wildfire. When workers stand up and fight for their dignity, there is no stopping them. https://t.co/j1BPuzF1JG

Putin and his oligarch friends don't want you to see these images. Participating in an anti-war march in an authoritarian country is no small thing. It requires enormous courage. These very brave people deserve our respect and gratitude. https://t.co/y8lYmNepds
Today, I stand in solidarity with the Ukrainian people against this war and with the Russian people who are demonstrating against their corrupt, reckless president who started it.

Putin, a multi-billionaire, is the poster boy for greed and oligarchy. Maybe, before starting a war that could kill thousands and displace millions, he might worry more about the people of Ukraine and Russia and less about his precious super-yacht. https://t.co/fVb5SjFXm5

Ice cream cakemakers at Jon Donaire bakery went on strike four months ago. They stood up to corporate greed, fought for dignity on the job, and they won.
 
Congratulations to the @BCTGM workers who secured a much improved contract. 
https://t.co/Bq0GTQZBuH
You and the work you are doing are an inspiration to so many of us. Thank YOU to the workers who are organizing every day against the forces of corporate greed. https://t.co/tpYmhnO1A2

If you start a job at Starbucks tomorrow, are you going to make a livable wage? "Absolutely not."

Will you be able to afford to see a doctor? "Not at all."

Unacceptable. https://t.co/ylP7871Dy0

Let me say a word to the younger generation. You have had it tough ‚Äî but in my humble opinion, you are a great generation. You are anti-racist, anti-sexist, anti-homophobia, anti-xenophobia. And your generation has shown the courage to take on corporate greed. https://t.co/YFH99lbIso

The organizing effort at Starbucks is spreading like wildfire. We‚Äôre LIVE now with workers who are taking on exactly the kind of corporate greed that is creating historic levels of inequality across this country.  

https://t.co/hOUbYbo7U9

LIVE: Starbucks is doing VERY well. Revenues are up. Profits are up. Even its CEO‚Äôs pay is up. So why is the company doing all it can to stop workers from organizing unions? We‚Äôre talking with Starbucks workers from around the country NOW to find out. https://t.co/hOUbYbFILH

Profits at Starbucks are UP and the CEO got a BIG raise last year. But the company is doing all it can to stop workers from organizing unions at locations around the country.¬†

Join me tonight at 8 PM ET as a few of them tell us how they're taking on Starbucks‚Äô greed. https://t.co/Ym9Mo02A36

It is no small feat to stand up to an enormous corporation like Starbucks and to say, "you know what? I deserve dignity, I deserve respect, I deserve a decent wage."

Join me and Starbucks workers for a town hall discussion TONIGHT at 8 PM ET. https://t.co/jIJzzrzLsq
Starbucks workers should be able to form a union without fear of being fired. End of discussion.

Take a look around the economy today.

McDonald's: profits up 59%. They're raising prices.

Starbucks: record profits. They're raising prices.

Amazon: record profits. Shock of shocks! They're raising prices!

Maybe ‚Äî just maybe ‚Äî we've got a corporate greed problem.

Workers at Starbucks have ignited a nationwide movement united in the struggle for dignity and respect on the job.
They're organizing in New York, in Tennessee, in California, and in states all across this country. Join our town hall discussion this Wednesday at 8 PM ET. https://t.co/JZLtMH74p6
Meanwhile, real wages for the working class of this country have barely budged in 50 years. https://t.co/J67GP66EbD

Think the Gilded Age is 'ancient history'? WRONG.

The average American worker produces far more today than they did decades ago, yet that worker is worse off economically than they were in 1973.

Many millions of Russians and Ukrainians died during World War II. The Russian and Ukrainian people do not need a new war, nor does the rest of the world. There is a diplomatic solution to this crisis. It is tragic that Putin seems intent on rejecting it.
This is what the war on women's rights looks like. They want to take us back to the 19th century. https://t.co/EGEj7UfRm3

A corrupt political system is 745 billionaires becoming $2.1 trillion richer during the pandemic, while 3.7 million children slipped back into poverty last month because corporate Republicans and corporate Democrats refused to extend the $300 a month Child Tax Credit.
Good. Now cancel the remaining $1,883,214,046,704 for 44,984,000 other Americans who are still drowning in student debt. https://t.co/Z9mkxKHst2

It is not a luxury to be able to hear the world around you.

It is not a luxury to keep teeth in your mouth.

It is not a luxury to be able to see the people around you.

Medicare can and must be expanded to cover hearing, dental, and vision care.

I‚Äôm endorsing Lee Merritt for Texas Attorney General because he understands that our broken criminal justice system puts poor people in jail while Wall Street crooks & pharmaceutical executives aren‚Äôt held accountable for their crimes. He has the courage to take on the powerful. https://t.co/NOPhnzgZlC

7 out of 10 millennials in this country are living paycheck to paycheck.
6 out of 10 millennials could not afford to cover a $1,000 emergency.
Nearly 7 in 10 are still working to pay off enormous amounts of student debt.

That's not an economy we should accept.

If we do not summon the courage to take on corporate greed, if we do not summon the courage to stand up to the moneyed interests, future generations will look back at this Congress and will rightly ask, 'where were you?'.

How is it that Warrior Met can afford $1.5 BILLION in stock buybacks, but somehow they cannot manage to afford to treat its workers with dignity and respect and pay them a decent wage? https://t.co/MICH66EMIf

Here is the economic situation in America today. Desperate workers who live paycheck to paycheck are forced to go to work. Thousands of them have died on the job. But hey, a handful of billionaires became over $2 trillion richer.

That's not an economic system we should accept.
Hear me out, because this is a far-out concept... what if instead we just made the wealthy and huge corporations pay their taxes here on earth? https://t.co/PjjLUK494t

.@GregCasar understands that what we need in the Congress in this moment in history are leaders who are willing to stand up and to act boldly in the interest of justice.

TEXAS: early voting is happening NOW until next Friday, February 25th. VOTE! VOTE! VOTE! https://t.co/0N0bQ9mgNV

We need @JCisnerosTX in the Congress to fight for decent-paying jobs and an economy that works for all of us.

Texas, early voting is underway from now until Friday, February 25th. VOTE! https://t.co/JWUOkd7w54

When you think about income and wealth inequality, it is less about the fact that billionaires are getting phenomenally richer. It is that tens of millions of working class Americans are needlessly suffering under economic hardship in the richest country ever to exist.

We are living through the most difficult period in our lifetimes. If you feel anxious, depressed, overwhelmed, confused, angry ‚Äî you‚Äôre not alone. Millions feel exactly the same way. But the answer is not to bury our heads in the sand or wallow in despair. It is to fight back.

I am proud to endorse @GregCasar for Congress. Greg is committed to fighting on behalf of this country's working class. From fighting to raise the minimum wage to enacting paid sick leave, he understands that in the richest country on earth, all of us can live a life of dignity. https://t.co/Hx0Ht1DY22

I am proud to endorse @JCisnerosTX for Congress. She knows that real change comes from the bottom on up, not the top on down. She will fight for the working class in Congress, and together we will build a movement to transform this nation so that it works for all our people. https://t.co/k05EeJeT9N

Listen to this.

According to a new study, if income for the bottom 90% of this country grew at the same rate as did overall economic growth since 1975, workers would have an additional $47 TRILLION.

When we talk about a rigged economy, that's exactly what we're talking about.

If you are an American in need of Advair Diskus for your asthma, you can expect to pay $1,277.
In Canada? $378.

If you are an American in need of Crestor for your cholesterol, you can expect to pay $969.
In Canada? $204.

The American people are getting ripped off. ENOUGH.
A handful of giant Wall Street firms now control over $20 trillion in assets and many hundreds of companies. Never before have so few owned and controlled so much.

I don't know how you bring about change without fighting for it ‚Äî I don't think you do. There is always struggle. Anybody who tells you that change takes place without a fight isn't telling you the truth ‚Äî they're trying to put you to sleep.

From 1979-2020:
Wages for the top 1%:  ‚¨ÜÔ∏è 179%
Wages for the top 0.1%: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è 389%
Wages for the bottom 90%: ‚¨ÜÔ∏è 28%

Who is our economy working for?

Taking on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry and lowering the cost of prescription drugs ‚Äî not a radical idea!

Accepting it as 'normal' that the American people pay 14 TIMES MORE for insulin than the people of England, now THERE'S a radical idea!

The problem is not that a low-income worker got a 50 cent raise two weeks ago and a $1,400 check last year. The problem is that corporations are using "inflation" as an excuse to jack up prices so that they can make record-breaking profits to enrich CEOs and wealthy shareholders.
The most effective way to deliver real power to this country's working class is by rebuilding the trade union movement.

You ready for a radical idea?

Maybe ‚Äî JUST MAYBE ‚Äî the Congress can begin to represent the needs of the people of this country, not the wishes of the pharmaceutical industry.

How many people in our country have to die?
How many of our people need to get unnecessarily sicker for Congress to summon the courage to stand up to Big Pharma's greed?

A life-saving drug doesn't mean a damn thing if you cannot afford the cost.

How much has Big Pharma spent lobbying members of the Republican and Democratic parties? $4.5 BILLION ‚Äî that's billion with a 'B'. 

Yes, you read that correctly ‚Äî BILLION.

Want to know why you pay 10x more for your prescription drugs than other major countries? Start there.

For decades, members of Congress have bemoaned the high price of prescription drugs.

They've given speech after speech. They've cut ad after ad. Talk, talk, talk. ENOUGH TALK!

It's time to act. Let's take on the greed of the pharmaceutical industry.
